author: Brian Turner
method: Mix the egg, oats and breadcrumbs together in a bowl. Dip the pork in the mixture to coat. Heat one tablespoon of the olive oil in a pan and fry the pork for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Meanwhile, gently heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a pan and sauté the apple and butternut for 8-10 minutes or until soft. Add the cream and wine and reduce to make a creamy sauce.  Serve the pork on top of the creamy vegetables.
ingredients: 1 escalope of pork,  1 egg, beaten,  50g/1¾oz oats,  50g/1¾oz breadcrumbs,  2 tbsp olive oil,  ½ apple, cored and sliced,  50g/1¾oz butternut squash, chopped,  3 tbsp double cream,  3 tbsp white wine
